maml:description.maml:para: Add-IdoItCategory
With Net-CmdbCategory you can add a category object for a given object.

maml:Description.maml:para: This parameter contains the id of the object you want to add a category
This parameter takes a constant name of a specific category
The data parameter takes a hashtable with all the key-value pairs of the category you want to add
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
This parameter contains the id of the object you want to add a category
With CatgId you can pass an id of a global category from table isysgui_catg
The data parameter takes a hashtable with all the key-value pairs of the category you want to add
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
This parameter contains the id of the object you want to add a category
With CatsId you can pass an id of a specific catgeory from table isysgui_cats
The data parameter takes a hashtable with all the key-value pairs of the category you want to add
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
This parameter contains the id of the object you want to add a category
This parameter takes a constant name of a specific category
With CatgId you can pass an id of a global category from table isysgui_catg
With CatsId you can pass an id of a specific catgeory from table isysgui_cats
The data parameter takes a hashtable with all the key-value pairs of the category you want to add
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Connect-Cmdb initalize the session to the idoit cmdb.
Connect-Cmdb initalize the session to the idoit cmdb.

maml:Description.maml:para: This is the apikey you define in idoit unter Settings-> Interface-> JSON-RPC API to access the api
This is the Uri to the idoit JSON-RPC API. It is always in the format http[s]://your.i-doit.host/src/jsonrpc.php
{{Fill Credential Description}}
You can provide a [Ref] parameter to the function to get back the raw response from the invoke to the I-doIt API.
You have to put the parameter in parantheses like this: -RawOutput ([Ref]$Output)
The return value is a Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.HtmlWebResponseObject
{{Fill NoTls Description}}
This parameter will be removed - for hashtable you can use paramter splatting
You can provide a [Ref] parameter to the function to get back the raw response from the invoke to the I-doIt API.
You have to put the parameter in parantheses like this: -RawOutput ([Ref]$Output)
The return value is a Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.HtmlWebResponseObject
{{Fill NoTls Description}}
You can provide a path to a settings file in json format. It must containt username, password, apikey and uri as key-value pairs
You can provide a [Ref] parameter to the function to get back the raw response from the invoke to the I-doIt API.
You have to put the parameter in parantheses like this: -RawOutput ([Ref]$Output)
The return value is a Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.HtmlWebResponseObject
{{Fill NoTls Description}}
{{Fill Credential Description}}
This is the apikey you define in idoit unter Settings-> Interface-> JSON-RPC API to access the api
This is the Uri to the idoit JSON-RPC API. It is always in the format http[s]://your.i-doit.host/src/jsonrpc.php
This parameter will be removed - for hashtable you can use paramter splatting
You can provide a path to a settings file in json format. It must containt username, password, apikey and uri as key-value pairs
You can provide a [Ref] parameter to the function to get back the raw response from the invoke to the I-doIt API.
You have to put the parameter in parantheses like this: -RawOutput ([Ref]$Output)
The return value is a Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.HtmlWebResponseObject
{{Fill NoTls Description}}

maml:alert.maml:para: Version 0.1.0 29.12.2017 CB initial release 0.2.0 31.12.2017 CB some major redesign for the parameter sets 0.3.0 02.01.2018 CB Using Credential object instead of username & password (https://github.com/PowerShell/PSScriptAnalyzer/issues/363) 0.3.1 03.01.2018 CB Added Verbose/Debug output, ParameterSplatting to the Invoke and RawOuput

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Connect-Cmdb -Username 'admin' -Password 'admin' -Uri 'https://demo.i-doit.com/src/jsonrpc.php' -ApiKey 'asdaur'

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will esatblish a session to demo.i-doit.com with api key asdaur for user admin

maml:description.maml:para: Disconnect-IdoIt destroys the session to idoit and removes all session variables
Disconnect-IdoIt destroys the session to idoit and removes all session variables

maml:alert.maml:para: Version 0.1.0 29.12.2017 CB initial release 0.2.0 01.01.2018 CB added removal of variable CmdbUri from global scope; Added Try/Catch Block

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Disconnect-IdoIt

maml:description.maml:para: Get-IdoItCategory
With Get-IdoItCategory you can retreive detailed information for a category for a given object.

maml:Description.maml:para: This parameter contains the id of the object you want to query a category
This parameter takes a constant name of a specific category
This parameter contains the id of the object you want to query a category
With CatgId you can pass an id of a global category from table isysgui_catg
This parameter contains the id of the object you want to query a category
With CatsId you can pass an id of a specific catgeory from table isysgui_cats
This parameter contains the id of the object you want to query a category
This parameter takes a constant name of a specific category
With CatgId you can pass an id of a global category from table isysgui_catg
With CatsId you can pass an id of a specific catgeory from table isysgui_cats

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-IdoItCategory -Id 3411 -Category "C__CATG__ACCOUNTING"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will return the accounting category for object 3411.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-IdoItCategory -Id 55 -CatsId 1

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will return the specific category with id 1 for object with id 55.

With CatsId you can pass an id of a specific catgeory from table isysgui_cats

maml:description.maml:para: Get-IdoItLocationTree
With Get-CmdbLOcationTree you can define a parent object and retreive all child objects that are bound to this location

maml:Description.maml:para: This is the object id of the parent object
This is the object id of the parent object

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-IdoItLocationTree -Id 38

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will return all objects assigned to the parent object location with id 38

maml:description.maml:para: Gets an object from the idoit cmdb and returns it as a idoit.object object
This cmdlet will return an idoit cmbd object for a provided id. The id can be get by find-idoitobject or by inspecting the idoit url when using the web interface.
Typically you will have an url like https://demo.i-doit.com/?objID=3569 The objID parameter contains the id.
So if you want to get the object from the above url with the Get-IdoItObject cmdlet you have to type in: Get-IdoitObject -Id 3569

maml:Description.maml:para: This is the unique id of the object you want to get pull from the idoit cmdb.
You can provide a [Ref] parameter to the function to get back the raw response from the invoke to the I-doIt API.
You have to put the parameter in parantheses like this: -RawOutput ([Ref]$Output)
The return value is a Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.HtmlWebResponseObject
This is the unique id of the object you want to get pull from the idoit cmdb.
You can provide a [Ref] parameter to the function to get back the raw response from the invoke to the I-doIt API.
You have to put the parameter in parantheses like this: -RawOutput ([Ref]$Output)
The return value is a Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.HtmlWebResponseObject

maml:alert.maml:para: Version 0.1.0 29.12.2017 CB initial release 0.2.0 05.01.2018 CB Added support for RawOuput; Improved inline help

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-IdoItObject -Id 1234

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will get the object with the id <1234>

maml:description.maml:para: Get-IdoItObjectByFilter
With Get-IdoItObjectByFilter you can get one or more objects from i-doit cmdb that can be filtered by type, name, sys-id etc.

maml:Description.maml:para: Set this parameter to filter objects by an array of object ids
Set this parameter to filter objects by a type id.
With Title you can fFilter objects by their title.
Filter objects by their sys id value.
Withe TypeTitle you can filter objects by type title.
With limit you can recuce the number of results you get back. Without Limit you get all objects that match your filter.
If you set the parameter sort objects will be ordered by the the property you define with the parameter OrderBy
With order by you can define what property is used for sorting objects in the result. Default is ID. The possbile values are "Id","TypeID","Title","TypeTitle","SysId","FirstName","LastName","Email"
Search for person objects by and filter by last name.
Search for person objects by and filter by first name.
Search for person objects by and filter by email adress.
With limit you can recuce the number of results you get back. Without Limit you get all objects that match your filter.
If you set the parameter sort objects will be ordered by the the property you define with the parameter OrderBy
With order by you can define what property is used for sorting objects in the result. Default is ID. The possbile values are "Id","TypeID","Title","TypeTitle","SysId","FirstName","LastName","Email"
Set this parameter to filter objects by an array of object ids
Set this parameter to filter objects by a type id.
With Title you can fFilter objects by their title.
Filter objects by their sys id value.
Withe TypeTitle you can filter objects by type title.
Search for person objects by and filter by first name.
Search for person objects by and filter by last name.
Search for person objects by and filter by email adress.
With limit you can recuce the number of results you get back. Without Limit you get all objects that match your filter.
If you set the parameter sort objects will be ordered by the the property you define with the parameter OrderBy
With order by you can define what property is used for sorting objects in the result. Default is ID. The possbile values are "Id","TypeID","Title","TypeTitle","SysId","FirstName","LastName","Email"

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-IdoItObjectByFilter -Title "web%" -Sort -OrderBy SysId

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will get all objects that begin with web in the title. The result is sorted by sysid

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-IdoItObjectByFilter -Email "john.doe@acme.com"

dev:remarks.maml:para: In this example you will get all perons with the email address <john.doe@acme.com>

maml:description.maml:para: Get-IdoItObjectType
Get-IdoItObjectType returns available object types. If you provide no parameters you will get all availabke object types from idoit.

maml:Description.maml:para: If provided the result will be filtered these Ids
If provided the result will be filtered by title
Limit the number results to the this value
Only return object types that are enabled
When you define this switch parameter, you will get the amount of objects per object type
If provided the result will be filtered these Ids
If provided the result will be filtered by title
Only return object types that are enabled
Limit the number results to the this value
When you define this switch parameter, you will get the amount of objects per object type

maml:alert.maml:para: The parameters order_by and sort are not used through the api. Instead you can use the PowerShell to sort results :-)

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-IdoItObjectType -Id 123,572,1349 -Enabled

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will return the object types 123, 572 and 1349 but will filter out objects if they are not enabled.

maml:description.maml:para: New-IdoItObject
New-IdoItObject lets you create a new object.
DYNAMIC PARAMETERS -Category <String> This parameter defines the dialog category on the general category. It is a dynamic parameter that will pull the available values in real time.
-Purpose <String> This parameter defines the dialog purpose on the general category. It is a dynamic parameter that will pull the available values in real time.

maml:Description.maml:para: This parameter either the type id or the the type name of the object you wan't to create.
This the title of the object you are creating.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
This parameter either the type id or the the type name of the object you wan't to create.
This the title of the object you are creating.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: New-IdoItObject -Type 5 -Title "srv12345.domain.de" -Purpose "Production"

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will create a new Object of type 5 (C_ OBJTYPE _SERVER) with the name srv12345.domain.de and the purpose "Production"

maml:description.maml:para: Remove-IdoItCategory
With Remove-IdoItCategory you can remove a category object for a given object.

maml:Description.maml:para: This parameter contains the id of the object you want to remove a category
This parameter takes a constant name of a specific category
This value is mandatory for multi value categories like CPU or hostaddress.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
This parameter contains the id of the object you want to remove a category
With CatgId you can pass an id of a global category from table isysgui_catg
This value is mandatory for multi value categories like CPU or hostaddress.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
This parameter contains the id of the object you want to remove a category
With CatsId you can pass an id of a specific catgeory from table isysgui_cats
This value is mandatory for multi value categories like CPU or hostaddress.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
This parameter contains the id of the object you want to remove a category
This parameter takes a constant name of a specific category
With CatgId you can pass an id of a global category from table isysgui_catg
With CatsId you can pass an id of a specific catgeory from table isysgui_cats
This value is mandatory for multi value categories like CPU or hostaddress.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Remove-IdoItObject
With Remove-IdoItObject you can archive, delete or purge a object from i-doit

maml:Description.maml:para: The id of the object you want to remove
When this switch is provided, the object is archived
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The id of the object you want to remove
When this switch is provided, the object is deleted
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The id of the object you want to remove
When this switch is provided, the object is purged
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The id of the object you want to remove
{{Fill Quickpurge Description}}
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The id of the object you want to remove
When this switch is provided, the object is archived
When this switch is provided, the object is deleted
When this switch is provided, the object is purged
{{Fill Quickpurge Description}}
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Remove-IdoItObject -Id 1234 -Archive

dev:remarks.maml:para: This will archive the object with the id 1234
